name: enhance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 to improve the quality, amount, or strength of something: These scandals will not enhance the organization's reputation.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's things like this that enhance the quality of life.The latest revelation certainly won't enhance her image.Smart personnel practices enhance the value of a company and its stock.A number of our clients want to look younger to enhance their career prospects.Pictures can then be enhanced on a pc.

to improve the quality, amount, or strength of something: The marinade enhances the flavor of the fish. The county took steps to enhance water quality. enhancement noun [ C/U ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ɪnˈhæns·mənt/
[ C ] The new system is a major enhancement in security. [ U ] Enhancement of local transportation is a priority.
Add to word list
Add to word list
to improve the quality, amount, or value of something: The convention is an opportunity to enhance your business knowledge and polish your networking skills. He believes that organizational effectiveness is enhanced by fair and ethical management. High productivity lowers costs and enhances value.
